body_content.explanation: examining or liking to examine things in detail, in order to discover more about them:
examples: New analytic techniques in biology are allowing scientists to study the cell in more detail.
The analytic methods we developed for this project will be useful for our future work.

body_content.explanation: relating to or using logic (= a formal scientific method of examining or thinking about ideas):
examples: This book is one of the masterpieces of analytic philosophy.

body_content.explanation: (of a statement) true only because of the meanings of the words, without referring to facts or experience:
examples: Analytic truth is only regarded as true because it is independent of experience.
All of their claims rely on empirical data and so are not purely analytic.

body_content.explanation: (of a language) showing grammar through word order rather than by changing the form of words:
examples: In analytic languages such as Mandarin, the relationships between words are shown solely by their order.
English is more analytic than Spanish.
